current-chamber.#text:
IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED
		  STATES

official-title.#text:
To ensure the complete and timely payment
		  of the obligations of the United States Government until May 19, 2013, and for
		  other purposes.

action-desc.#text:
Read the second time and placed on the
			 calendar

attestation-date.#text:
Passed the House of
			 Representatives January 23, 2013.

header.#text:
Holding salaries
			 of members of congress in escrow upon failure to agree to budget
			 resolution

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 301 of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
the payroll administrator of that House of Congress
			 shall deposit in an escrow account all payments otherwise required to be made
			 during such period for the compensation of Members of Congress who serve in
			 that House of Congress, and shall release such payments to such Members only
			 upon the expiration of such period.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: No Budget, No Pay Act of 2013/s:3/ss:b/p:2

text.#text:
If by April 15, 2013, a House of Congress has not agreed
			 to a concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2014 pursuant to

With respect to a House of Congress, the period
			 described in this paragraph is the period which begins on April 16, 2013, and
			 ends on the earlier of—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 301 of the Congressional Budget Act of
			 1974

text.#text:
the day on which
			 the House of Congress agrees to a concurrent resolution on the budget for

the last day of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that
			 would apply to the payment if the payment were not subject to
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: No Budget, No Pay Act of 2013/s:3/ss:b/p:1
No Budget, No Pay Act of 2013/s:3/ss:b/p:1

text.#text:
The payroll
			 administrator shall provide for the same withholding and remittance with
			 respect to a payment deposited in an escrow account under

header.#text:
Withholding and
			 remittance of amounts from payments held in escrow

text.#text:
In order to ensure that this
			 section is carried out in a manner that shall not vary the compensation of
			 Senators or Representatives in violation of the twenty-seventh article of
			 amendment to the Constitution of the United States, the payroll administrator
			 of a House of Congress shall release for payments to Members of that House of
			 Congress any amounts remaining in any escrow account under this section on the
			 last day of the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress.

header.#text:
Release of
			 amounts at end of the congress

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 provide the payroll administrators of the Houses of Congress with such
			 assistance as may be necessary to enable the payroll administrators to carry
			 out this section.

header.#text:
Role of
			 secretary of the treasury

term.#tail:
includes a Delegate or Resident Commissioner to the
			 Congress.

quote.#tail: of a House of Congress means—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Chief Administrative Officer of the House of
			 Representatives

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

			 Secretary of the Senate who is designated by the Secretary to carry out this
			 section.
